hypothesis_content.title: Bear-to-Neutral Transition via RSI Divergence at Key Support
hypothesis_content.statement: During a BEAR regime, if BTC forms a lower price low while 4-hour RSI(14) forms a higher low (bullish divergence) at a major historical support level (e.g., prior cycle high, 200-day SMA), and is accompanied by a surge in spot buying volume (>1.5x 20-day average), this signals an impending transition to NEUTRAL regime, offering a tactical long entry.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Bear regimes exhaust at support. Bullish RSI divergence indicates slowing downward momentum. High spot volume at support suggests institutional or strong hands accumulating, increasing probability of a stabilization (NEUTRAL regime) rather than an immediate reversal to BULL.
entry_conditions: BTC makes a 7-day low in price
BTC 4h RSI(14) shows higher low vs. prior 7-day low (divergence)
Divergence occurs within 5% of a key defined support level
Spot volume (USD) on divergence candle > 1.5x 20-day average 4h volume

exit_conditions.take_profit: Regime indicator flips to NEUTRAL for 2 consecutive days
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC closes >3% below the identified support level (breakdown)
exit_conditions.time_exit: 5 days without a regime flip to NEUTRAL

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Majority of such divergence signals at support are followed by a continued BEAR regime (price breaks support) rather than a transition to NEUTRAL.
